Line 272: Line 272:
{{As of|2011|June}} Google said that 550,000 new Android devices were being activated every day<ref>{{cite news |url=http://old.news.yahoo.com/s/digitaltrends/20110628/tc_digitaltrends/googleactivates500000androiddevicesadaymayreach1millionbyoctober |title=Google activates 500,000 Android devices a day, may reach 1 million in October |work=Yahoo News |date=28 June 2011}}</ref>âup from 400,000 per day two months earlier in May 2011 -and more than 100 million devices have been activated.<ref name="i/o 2011 stats"/> Android hit 300,000 activations per day back in December 2010.
{{As of|2011|June}} Google said that 550,000 new Android devices were being activated every day<ref>{{cite news |url=http://old.news.yahoo.com/s/digitaltrends/20110628/tc_digitaltrends/googleactivates500000androiddevicesadaymayreach1millionbyoctober |title=Google activates 500,000 Android devices a day, may reach 1 million in October |work=Yahoo News |date=28 June 2011}}</ref>âup from 400,000 per day two months earlier in May 2011 -and more than 100 million devices have been activated.<ref name="i/o 2011 stats"/> Android hit 300,000 activations per day back in December 2010.
In July 14, 2011 550,000 Android devices are now activated by Google each day with growth 4.4 percent per week.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://techcrunch.com/2011/07/14/android-now-seeing-550000-activations-per-day/ |title=Android Now Seeing 550,000 Activations Per Day |first=Greg |last=Kumparak |work=Techcrunch |date=14 July 2011}}</ref>
In July 14, 2011 550,000 Android devices are now activated by Google each day with growth 4.4 percent per week.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://techcrunch.com/2011/07/14/android-now-seeing-550000-activations-per-day/ |title=Android Now Seeing 550,000 Activations Per Day |first=Greg |last=Kumparak |work=Techcrunch |date=14 July 2011}}</ref>
  +
In July 29, 2011 [[ABI Research]] estimates Android has about 46% of the smartphone marketshare.<ref>http://www.abiresearch.com/press/3740-Samsung%E2%80%99s+Q2+Smartphone+Growth+Shows+that+the+Race+Is+Its+to+Lose</ref><ref>http://www.linuxfordevices.com/c/a/News/ABI-Research-Q2-2011-smartphone-study-plus-HTC-Sensation-teardown/</ref>
